Congratulations to Benning Middle Campus Preppies Amari Edmonds and Tyler Willis for winning DC's 2020 Do the Write Thing Challenge with their anti-violence essays.

We are so proud of these Preppies, who wrote with intelligence, eloquence, and passion about the urgency of ending gun violence. Benning Middle Campus, with guidance from 7th and 8th Grade Social Studies Teacher Ms. Watkins, also submitted the most essays!

Their voices, and all of the other student voices, are essential on this important health and safety issue.
shared_text:
Attorney General Karl A. Racine
June 3 at 1:19 PM ·

CONGRATULATIONS! The 2020 winners for DC’s “Do the Write Thing” Challenge anti-violence essay contest are . . . Amari Edmonds and Tyler Willis: bit.ly/2A1gNyP

Amari Edmonds, 8th grade, DC Prep Benning Middle School: She writes about the impact violence has had on her personally and on the District, and suggests that to break cycles of violence, we need to do more to support and educate black children.

Tyler Willis, 8th grade, DC Prep Benning Middle School: Throughout his poem he references the divergent paths a young life can take without a proper support system and the power of song as a metaphor for healing and strength.

This year, 240+ students participated from 13 different schools!
